P

pause() - Method in class bytemusketeers.heslingtonhustle.PlayScreen
Handles the PlayScreen, and hence general gameplay execution, being paused
pauseMenu - Variable in class bytemusketeers.heslingtonhustle.PlayScreen
The transient-rendered pause menu Overlay, intended to be displayed to the user upon request, or a system event such as loss of PlayScreen focus
PauseMenu - Class in bytemusketeers.heslingtonhustle.ui
The PauseMenu provides a pleasant Overlay to display upon a pause being requested, or a game Screen losing focus.
PauseMenu(SpriteBatch) - Constructor for class bytemusketeers.heslingtonhustle.ui.PauseMenu
Creates a new PauseMenu relating to the given SpriteBatch

PlayerMetric - Class in bytemusketeers.heslingtonhustle.metrics
A PlayerMetric represents a MetricEntry pertaining to the player-controlled character to be managed by the MetricController.
PlayerMetric() - Constructor for class bytemusketeers.heslingtonhustle.metrics.PlayerMetric
 
playerTexture - Variable in class bytemusketeers.heslingtonhustle.scene.Character
The visual representation of the Character
playScreen - Variable in class bytemusketeers.heslingtonhustle.HeslingtonHustle
The LibGDX Screen array used to store all active Game-wide Screen instantiations
playScreen - Variable in class bytemusketeers.heslingtonhustle.scene.AreaFactory
The PlayScreen on which the Area objects generated by the AreaFactory should be rendered.
PlayScreen - Class in bytemusketeers.heslingtonhustle
The PlayScreen class represents a screen which is shown after the game starts, implementing Screen interface.
PlayScreen(SpriteBatch) - Constructor for class bytemusketeers.heslingtonhustle.PlayScreen
Instantiates a new PlayScreen to be used for the playing area of the game.
PlayScreen.GameState - Enum in bytemusketeers.heslingtonhustle
Distinguish between internal game states; used to inform, among others, the PlayScreen.render(float)} and PlayScreen.handleInput() cycles
PPM - Static variable in class bytemusketeers.heslingtonhustle.HeslingtonHustle
'PPM' denotes the number of pixels-per-(in-game)-metre.
